page.title: 09EDUCATION..SCHOOL CLOSURE
page.content: {Collessie School.} The issue of rural primary school closures is a very important one in N.E. Fife. Collessie Primary at one time served both the village children and those of the workers from surrounding farms. The workers were mobile and caused numbers in the school to flucctuate. However, increasing mechanisation of farms greatly lessened the need for farm workers and, allied with a general decline in family size, the school role fell dramatically. Pupil numbers were 1889_114: 1922_45: 1939_80 (this included wartime evacuees):1971_32: 1977_15: 1982_6: In July 1982 with the 6 remaining pupils being in their later years at school, Collessie primary School finally closed.
